content: Yuto Mori is an engineer working in Tokyo. In addition to the theoretical aspects of machine learning, he also likes practical implementations, and aims to solve any problems (using data and algorithms if necessary).
summary: Yuto Mori is an engineer working in Tokyo. In addition to the theoretical aspects of machine learning, he also likes practical implementations, and aims to solve any problems (using data and algorithms if necessary).
title: Yuto Mori / 森 雄人

content:
We have published our paper in arXiv.
Yuto Mori, Atsushi Nitanda, and Akiko Takeda. BODAME: Bilevel Optimization for Defense Against Model Extraction. 2021. [arXiv]
As the title suggests, we formulate the problem of defending machine learning models from model extraction attacks as a bilevel optimization problem, and propose methods to solve.
In addition, I have published some of the survey materials that I had compiled when I was a master’s student.
  PDF  GitHub repository  It’s a survey that I’ve been compiling as a diary as we move into the coronavirus crisis. It mainly summarizes topics related to model extraction attacks, but also includes some abstracts of papers on the following topics.
 Active Learning Semi-supervised Learning Kernel Methods Machine Teaching Gaussian Process Poisoning Meta-Learning
summary: publication in arXiv & survey in GitHub
title: BODAME: Bilevel Optimization for Defense Against Model Extraction
